alert.note: Alert for Penobscot (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued October 15 at 3:54AM EDT until October 15 at 6:00AM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...THE FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 600 AM EDT FOR SOUTH CENTRAL PENOBSCOT COUNTY... At 344 AM EDT, Bangor Fire reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain in the city of Bangor. Numerous roads in the city are impassable and several vehicles are disabled. Up to four inches of rain have already fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other drainage and low lying areas. Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bangor, Old Town, Orono, Brewer, Hampden, Hermon, Veazie, Kenduskeag, Indian Island, Glenburn, Orrington, Holden, Milford, Levant, Eddington, Hudson, Bradley, Greenbush, Bradford and Alton. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
